headline: Simple Macaroni and Cheese
description: Easy mac and cheese is simple to prepare with 7 ingredients you most likely already have on hand for tasty, comfort-food meal.

video.description: Creamy, decadent macaroni and cheese to have for a meal or a tasty side dish!
video.name: Simple Macaroni and Cheese

name: Simple Macaroni and Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, 8 minutes.
At the same time, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add flour, salt, and pepper and stir until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Pour in milk slowly, while stirring continuously. Continue to cook and stir until mixture is smooth and bubbling, about 5 minutes, making sure the milk doesn't burn.
Add Cheddar cheese and stir until melted, 2 to 4 minutes.
Drain macaroni and fold into cheese sauce until coated.

review.reviewBody: Easy, creamy, kid friendly and delicious!

I love this recipe and how easy it was to make. I had everything on hand we didn’t need a pound of butter and a ton of eggs and it still came out Delicious! I added a pinch of thyme to my recipe and a lil more salt and that’s it.

It was easy to make. I used cheddar and added some paprika, honey mustard, and garlic granules. I also added a little more cheese than the recipe called for, and I used half-and-half instead of milk. I topped it with panko breadcrumbs before putting it into the oven. Next time, I may mix in some crumbled crispy bacon. Much much better than boxed mac and cheese. My husband fell in love with me all over again.
I added cilantro greens extra cheese and lots of pepper but this meal is delicious

I’ve made home made several times and this one here this one hit,. Fully customizable starter package for anyone wanting to go the extra. like I said, I didn’t do much do it either little bit, onion powder, paprika, dry mustard, cumin of course or maybe little that, also did about extra cup of milk and x2 with the butter but great dish all sides of the kitchen
I have been hungry for mac and cheese since Lent started. This recipe was a God send. I added thawed corn to it, which gave it a slightly sweet taste. Yummy.

So yummy! For me I ended up needing to add like a half cup more noodles but that maybe become I shredded my own cheese. Cause I had more cheese sauces than noodles but that was an easy fix. I add parm to mine and also peas. And it’s almost just as easy as boxed Mac but so much better!!!! I do add much more salt and seasoning. It’s really a great base to add whatever you like to it.
I did add some parm but it was delicious as is
Was very good! I don’t like a lot of noodles so I done half to make it extra cheesy. Other than that followed as directed and was very good
perfect. very thick though.
Amazing. I added peas, broccoli and cauliflower. It is delicious.
SOOO EASY AND DELICIOUS!! The easiest yummiest mac n cheese I've ever made. Made this for the kiddo, next time I'll make it keto friendly and do cauliflower and coconut flour!
Very creamy next time I may add 2-4oz more of noodles. It was good.
This recipe was so creamy and delicious!! It also had a sticky consistency that added to the creamy cheese sauce.
Lacked flavor it was super bland i shouldve added more seasonings and stuff to it
i didn’t like this very much. It didn’t have much flavor and tasted off. Looks good, tastes not so good. Ps) i used shell noodles instead of macaroni noodles.

The sauce is very thin. My butter flour seemed thin for sauce, I cooked it down well too. I ended up adding some pasta water I to try and thicken it more but even after adding my noodles, it is almost soup. Definitely add in some seasonings and veg or ham or whatever. This is a very basic cheese sauce, with not a whole lot of flavor. Good for getting the idea of how to make a cheese sauce.
Pretty solid Mac n cheese! Made this for my friends and they loved it!
Absolutely Awesome! Smooth , creamy and oh so cheesy! THE PERFECT Mac and cheese!😋
Way too runny, for me.
Perfect as is! Family loved it!! I will just double the macaroni next time since there's so much sauce. Thank you so much for this fabulous recipe!!!!
delicious, terribly difficult to screw up. added some shredded Babybel cheese along with some cream cheese to give it that velvety texture.

As above was pretty nice, it could use a little more flavor, but as suggested, this is a "simple mac and cheese." I changed a thing or two here and there for my own taste. This recipe will give you some great ideas of where to start from and people will soon be giving you your own 5 stars.
im gonna be extremely honest it was amazing.
IT WAS SO BAD A THREE YEAR OLD COULD COOK BETTER YOU DUMB IDIOT
Amazing recipe and so creamy!
I like the easiness of it. Sorry I put in oven after I thought it was very dry. Also needed more flavor. I added paprika and garlic but still missing something. I have to tweak it.

This is just further proof that if you can make a basic roux then you have all the skills necessary to make a BANGING mac in just minutes. Other than salt and pepper, I add a pinch of garlic powder, nutmeg, cayenne, and paprika to mine (along with some red pepper flakes because I like spice). I also like to add microwaved broccoli to this to pretend I’m healthy. My personal choice of cheeses are hand shredded cheddar and Gruyère (2:1 ratio), but you can serious do this with anything including just whatever bagged Mexican blend cheese you have sitting around in the fridge. Preshredded cheese doesn’t melt quite as well but taste wise there’s not a massive difference.
Really good. Basic recipe. Difficult to mess it up. I added half a medium onion and 2 cloves of garlic. Salt, thyme, crushed red pepper. It's a keeper!
Yummy mac and cheese and easy.
it was great. the family loved it
I was craving Mac and cheese but it’s not available in my country. And every other time I failed with the roux and becoming all grainy, but this was worked!! I’m so happy right now.
It was great, my daughters loved it! I double the receipt so kept the second dish in the freezer for next week.

I have made tgis many times. My family members all have different taste buds. This is a wonderful simple recipe to add whatever spices you or your family like. I like to add garlic and herb bread crumbs on top.
I put bread crumbs with Italian seasoning and put it on the oven at 425 for 10 minutes till the bread crumbs were toasted. DELISH!!!
I use New York sharp cheddar cheese. A family favorite for way back.
My Family loved it!! To add a little crunch I also crushed up garlic croutons to sprinkle on top and it was amazing!!
followed to a t. ended up clumpy?? and wayyy too thick. still gave it a chance and it was grainy and bland

I almost gave this a 3 because it was very bland. it may have been my fault because I mixed cheddar with another Belle Vita cheese which I thought would add an interesting flavor but I added extra salt, extra pepper, garlic powder, Chalua, mustard and celery salt. Finally ended up adding salsa on top at the table. I liked the ease of the recipe and will try it again but will look at some of the other recipes to see what spices are added, plus I will either go all Cheddar or another stronger flavored cheese.

I love mac and cheese, but I was tired of making KD , and I had shredded cheese that week, so I looked up a simple homemade recipe. This recipe was so cheesy and delicious. I added Club Houses' 'Parmesan & Herbs' and it gave it a good kick. I also used Fusilli instead of Macaroni, just because I prefer them more.

This is similar to what I make, but for those asking for more flavor this is what I do- add dried minced onion to the butter (about 1-2 t), salt and pepper to taste, a pinch of nutmeg and about 8 shakes each Frank's Red hot sauce and Worchestershire. Can eat out of pan or make with crushed Ritz and melted butter.

I've been making this for decades, and my mother did the same before me. It's an excellent basic mac and cheese recipe that is almost a hundred years old, as it is featured in an old cook book I have from the 1920s. This is probably why it may seem bit bland to some modern day taste buds. Heavily spiced and flavoured foods weren't quite so common a hundred years ago. It's pretty kid friendly as is, though. We usually bake it, but I've done stove top as well.
This recipe is quick easy and delicious.
I added more cheese, but overall, this recipe made some really good Mac & Cheese!
This made way more sauce than needed

This makes a great cheese sauce, however, it needs a 16 oz box of macaroni, not 8 oz. I've got far too much sauce for the amount of noodles I cooked. I'm hoping it doesn't thicken up too much before the other 8 oz boils.

OMGOSH this is the simplest Mac and Cheese recipe around. I make this a lot not just for holidays. My families LOVE it! It doesn't take much more time than the box does and 10,000 X's the taste!!!! Pam M Kingman, AZ

This is a good base recipe. In my opinion it needs jazzed up a bit. I added mustard powder, paprika and nutmeg for additional flavor. This comes out a very good consistency. I also had success topping it with breadcrumbs and baking it.
Super simple and easy recipe. Personally, I used Cabot’s Seriously Sharp Vermont Cheddar. My husband and I couldn’t stop eating it! 11/10 this recipe is going in my normal meal rotation.
Very easy recipe to follow and it tasted delicious. It just did not reheat well, so eat it fresh
Super easy to make and tasty.
No changes. Raves from all.

The recipe was amazing, but I did add my own little twist. To get rid of the sharp bitter cheddar taste I added cream cheese with my cheddar. Absolutely delicious and creamy, it will now be my new go to white cheddar mac and cheese dish. The picture is my mac and cheese on top of the stove as a side dish to go with other side dishes. If I was going to use it as more of a main dish I would put it in the oven with some other toppings. Toppings being bread crumbs or Ritz cracker crumbs with butter.
Chunkyy
It was good, my son said it’s not cheesy enough.
Very easy to make. I made a 3 cheese blend with cheddar, mozzarella and shredded parmesan. It turned out fantastic a hit with my family. Will definitely make this again .

I was looking for a quick mac and cheese and took a chance with this one. It came together easily. For some reason, I had over a cup of sauce left - which I did not use. The recipe lacked flavor. The texture was not creamy like the boxed stuff the kids love. My company ate it, but this recipe was a hard no for me.

I loved this recipe. I like spicy food and my mom told me to use some cream and pasta sauce so I used cream instead of milk,1/2 cup pasta sauce, 1 tsp green chili paste and 1/2tsp garlic, paprika and herbs It was delicious
Yummo! I made this sauce and served it over pasta with pan friend zucchini and capsicum and threw in some leftover canned lentils. Was delicious!

YUMMO! Made this while having a couple wines with the girls 😂🍷 … Hubbies had a night out…. Kids are such picky eaters these days! Back in my day, I ate dirt on my potatoes and loved it! Made this recipe & couldn’t recommend enough! absolutely delicious! The family of 9 enjoyed it througholy! i’ll be making it again next week! Cheers! 😉🍝
I love how the macaroni was sooo cheesy and delicious

This is the first ever macaroni and cheese from scratch my now 17-yr old son has ever liked! My 2nd son (15) says he likes this better than the box. Can you hear angels singing? Lol . Just used up the cheese I had on hand: parmesan and a Mexican blend. Yay!
Way too much roux. It is like noodles floating in gritty biscuit gravy.
i just added some mayonnaise to the sauce. Judging by the result it turned out great
I doubled the recipe and it worked well. My only comment would be when I make a roux and put cheese in it, it always has a grainy texture. Can someone tell me what's wrong?
I used 4 different cheeses and put crushed Ritz crackers on top and baked it for 15 minutes. Delicious!
I like Mac and cheese
IT WAS SO GOOD
It was alright a bit bland maybe I will add corn for texture and corned beef or tuna for more flavor next time

This is my favorite base recipe for mac and cheese. I find it too much cheese sauce for the amount of noodles and use about 60% of the recommended sauce per noodles. I make it based on how much milk I am trying to get rid of, and use any cheeses I have. A touch of blue cheese is really good. Garlic salt as well. I usually make this after my son heads back to his mothers, I don't drink milk, and he has always hated mac and cheese. So great solo meal for me. The left overs I heat in the oven with bread crumbs on top.
Very good! I just added a little more salt.

I love this quick macaroni and cheese recipe. I found it bland tasting so I used 1/2 pepper jack cheese and 1/2 cheddar. I also added some paprika. Not spicy but not bland either. I’m making this recipe instead of baked or boxed for my family. After this modification, I would give the recipe 5 stars.👍
best yet -family loved it creamy and delicious
A nice easy recipe to follow to whip up a nice meal to feed the family. Thanks!

This is the same recipe that I’ve been making for about 40 years for my kids and grandchildren. The parents make it the same way, but the grandkids always say mine tastes better because I add love to mine!
So easy. Tastes great. I put in extra cheese. So good!

I made the recipe exactly as specified to get a base mac but it was a little soupy. It got better after it sat for a few minutes but still was runny. I'm not a pro chef so I don't know if I need more flour or less milk or what. I did use 0% milk. Next time I think I'll try more cheese (because I want more of a cheesy flavor) and less butter (because this calls for a ridiculous amount).
Simple yet delicious!!
I'm a terrible cook, but this came out great. The kids were shocked.. LOL Easy. Quick. Tasty.

it was good, not amazing but fast , easy and tasted alright for no cream mac n cheese, I added an extra half to 3/4 cup of cheese and ended up adding some more flour to thicken it up to where I like it

Great basic recipe! I added maybe 1/2 tsp-1tsp of onion powder, and used the Costco shredded Mexican cheese, which contains cheddar and a few others. Doubled the recipe, there was a lot of sauce, I wonder if maybe I could have doubled the pasta and just did 1.5x the sauce.

Holy smokes, this recipe was so easy and so good! Tastes like the Trader Joe’s frozen mac n cheese. I used a combo of shredded cheddar and a bit of the Mexican blend from TJ’s. For milk I used mostly plain almond milk and a bit of half and half to make it richer. SO EASY and so good. The cheese sauce seemed really stretchy and gooey at first but it all came together and mixed perfectly with some leftover plain bow tie noodles I had. This is a game changer. I have 4 kids and work full time and this took as long to pull together as a box of mac n cheese.
Super tasty!! Simple and nice❤️
Add cheese and milk at the same time
It was delicious. Perfect recipe for my family.

I doubled this and added a few seasonings to give it an extra kick. It's amazing, will add again. 

Add a pinch of Onion power, Tony's, and garlic salt. 

I also put Tabasco and bacon bits in it. Was delish. 

Lastly, I shredded Colby Jack and Mild Cheddar cheeses. Amazing Recipe and thank you, all 3 kids can't get enough of it!
this was so yum, shout-out to whoever made this recipe, my tastebuds were blessed

I virtually followed the recipe however I cooked the noodles in chicken broth instead of water and I put cream cheese in the sauce and still with those changes this was so bland and tasted like flour. I ended up adding cream of bacon soup, bacon bits, green onions, and breadcrumb topping and even after that it was hardly edible, I won't be making this one again and wouldn't recommend anyone else try it either..
I thought it was very bland.
This recipe worked really well!
I give this a 5, made the recipe to the tee. The sauce does get thick - I folded the sauce in with the macaroni and after I did that added more milk. No problems. Add extra cheese on top. Delicious
Made a double batch and it was fantastic. Added extra cheese on top and melted in oven. A real keeper.
It was the recipe I was looking for. The one my mother uses with adding a can of tomatoes or tomatoes paste and some paprika
This is the best and easiest Mac and cheese I’ve ever made. The only thing I changed was I added some onion powder. My whole family adored it

#1 I live in Wisconsin. #2 I'm a TERRIBLE cook. Made this and my best friend who was born and raised in Wisconsin, told me it was the best thing he ever put in his mouth. I add bacon, ham, fresh jalapeños or all three. Thx for making me look amazing!!!
Protein pasta works great! Used a few different cheeses and was so yummy
It's what you want Mac-&-cheese to be.

I'm sorry, but is this brown goop what you call cheese sauce?
Wasted all my cheddar on this
Baked it for 30 minutes at 325 degrees and it was WONDERFUL!!
